name: Fixed-Term Employment Contract (Ghana)
description: Ghana-compliant fixed-term employment contract designed to strictly comply with the Labour Act, 2003 (Act 651) and avoid automatic permanent status issues.

clauses.clause_text: This Fixed-Term Employment Contract (the 'Agreement') is made on {{agreement_date}} between {{employer_name}}, a company incorporated in Ghana (the 'Employer') and {{employee_name}} (the 'Employee').

The Employee is appointed as {{position_title}}. This is a fixed-term contract commencing on {{start_date}} and terminating automatically without notice on {{end_date}}. The parties expressly agree that there is no expectation of renewal or permanent employment.
The first {{probation_months}} months of employment shall be a probationary period. During this time, either party may terminate this Agreement with {{probation_notice_days}} days' notice.

The Employee shall receive a gross monthly salary of {{monthly_salary}} (GHS). The Employer shall make mandatory SSNIT contributions (13%) and deduct the Employee's portion (5.5%) as per Ghanaian law.

The Employee is entitled to {{annual_leave_days}} days of paid annual leave (minimum 15 days under Act 651). The Employee is also entitled to paid sick leave upon production of a medical certificate from a recognized practitioner.

Notwithstanding the fixed term, either party may terminate this Agreement by giving {{notice_period}} months' written notice or payment of salary in lieu of notice. The Employer may terminate summarily for proven gross misconduct in accordance with Section 63 of Act 651.
This Agreement is governed by the Labour Act, 2003 (Act 651) and the laws of the Republic of Ghana.
